summary: Esophageal cancer is a group of cancers that affect the esophagus, the tube that connects the throat to the stomach. It is the eighth most frequently diagnosed cancer worldwide and a significant cause of cancer-related deaths. The prognosis is generally poor due to late presentation with advanced disease. Two main types are esophageal squamous-cell carcinoma (ESCC) and esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC).
risk_factors: Geographical location (e.g., Asian esophageal cancer belt for ESCC, Western countries for EAC)
diagnosis: Imaging (MRI, CT, or ultrasound) for organ involvement
Imaging (MRI, CT, or ultrasound) for organ involvement
treatments: Chemotherapy (cisplatin-based, carboplatin, oxaliplatin, fluorouracil, capecitabine, epirubicin, nivolumab, pembrolizumab)
Endoscopic therapy (for stage 0 and I disease)
